pageContext.claim: “We thought we'd have an unemployment of 40, 42%. You know what it was? It dropped down to 7.8%.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump keeps acting as if job "creation"numbers are not connected to the coronavirus pandemic. More than 22 million jobs disappeared between mid-February and mid-April. About half of those jobs  were recovered in the  as covid-19 restrictions eased and many businesses were allowed to reopen. But  as of mid-September, total employment was still 3.9 million lower than where it was when Trump took office in January 2017.
